atAGlance.mustRegister: Persons meeting Florida’s sexual offender definition (F.S. 943.0435) or court-designated sexual predators (F.S. 775.21). Out-of-state designations generally carry over when establishing residence/presence.
atAGlance.initialDeadline: Within 48 hours: register in person with the county sheriff; then within 48 hours obtain/update a compliant DL/ID at DHSMV (F.S. 322.141(3)).
atAGlance.verificationCadence: Offenders: twice yearly (birth month + 6 months). Predators: quarterly. Some offenders must verify quarterly based on offense list.
atAGlance.primaryMethod: In person at sheriff + in person at DHSMV for ID; many ongoing changes may be reported online to FDLE or in person.
topGotchas: International travel requires 21-day notice to the sheriff.
Changes to vehicles, phone numbers, employment, higher-ed status, emails, and internet identifiers generally due within 48 hours.

whoMustRegister: Persons meeting ‘sexual offender’ criteria in F.S. 943.0435(1)(h) (in-state convictions; similar out-of-state offenses/designations upon residence/presence; certain juvenile adjudications; supervision transfers) and those designated ‘sexual predator’ under F.S. 775.21.
deadlinesReporting: Initial sheriff registration within 48 hours after establishing permanent/temporary/transient residence, release, or qualifying conviction if not in DOC/DJJ custody. (F.S. 943.0435(2))
DHSMV DL/ID update within 48 hours after sheriff registration. (F.S. 943.0435(3); 322.141(3))
Name/residential address changes: report to DHSMV within 48 hours; if unable, report to sheriff. (F.S. 943.0435(4)(a))
Vacating residence without new one: report to sheriff within 48 hours; transient: report within 48 hours of becoming transient, then every 30 days. (F.S. 943.0435(4)(b))
Moving out of Florida to establish residence: report intent to sheriff at least 48 hours before leaving. International travel: report at least 21 days before departure. (F.S. 943.0435(7))
Report within 48 hours: vehicles, phone numbers, employment, higher-ed status, email addresses, and internet identifiers. (F.S. 943.0435(4)(e))
verificationInPerson: Offenders: reregister in person during birth month AND the 6th month after. (F.S. 943.0435(14)(a))
Quarterly reregistration applies if offense is in 943.0435(14)(b). (F.S. 943.0435(14)(b))
Predators: quarterly (birthday month and every third month). (F.S. 775.21)
residencyPresence: No single statewide distance restriction is in the registration statutes; some localities have ordinances on residency/presence or loitering near child-focused locations. Court rulings may limit/preempt local rules—check local codes and case law.
employmentEducationInternet: Report higher-ed enrollment/volunteer/employment, including campus info. (F.S. 943.0435(2)(b)2, (14)(c)2)
Employment changes due within 48 hours (online or in person). (F.S. 943.0435(4)(e)2)
Register email addresses and internet identifiers within 48 hours after use; if under DOC/DJJ, report before using. (F.S. 943.0435(4)(e)1)
publicWebsiteExposure: FDLE public site lists offenders and predators; predators receive enhanced community notification. (F.S. 943.043; 775.21(7))
travelInterstate: Out-of-state move: report in person to sheriff at least 48 hours before departing to establish residence elsewhere. (F.S. 943.0435(7))
International travel: report at least 21 days before departure with itinerary details. (F.S. 943.0435(7))
complianceEnforcement: Failure to register, update DL/ID, report changes, or comply with verification can be a felony (often third degree; some second degree). Altering/possessing DL/ID without required markings is unlawful. (F.S. 943.0435(9); 322.212(5)(c))
reliefPaths: Offenders: lifetime registration by default; removal is limited and must satisfy state and federal criteria. (F.S. 943.0435(11))
Predators: lifetime designation unless conviction is set aside or full pardon; removal requires meeting statutory criteria and court action. (F.S. 775.21)
specialPopulations: Transient/houseless: report status and re-report every 30 days. (F.S. 943.0435(4)(b)2)
Under DOC/DJJ supervision: some updates must be made through DOC/DJJ before use (e.g., internet identifiers). (F.S. 943.0435(4)(e)1)
costs: Registrant is responsible for DHSMV fees for required DL/ID issuance/renewal. (F.S. 943.0435(3)(b); 775.21(6)(f)2)

newArrivalChecklist: Within 48 hours: register at sheriff; then update DL/ID at DHSMV.
Within 48 hours: report vehicles, phones, employment, higher-ed, emails, internet IDs.
Calendar your reregistration cadence (twice yearly or quarterly).
For international travel, calendar the 21-day notice.
movingOutChecklist: At least 48 hours BEFORE leaving FL to establish residence elsewhere: report intent to sheriff with destination details.
If plans change and you remain in FL, report that in person within 48 hours of the stated departure date.
If transient during the move, follow 30-day transient reporting.

summary: Expect two stops: sheriff registration and DMV for a marked ID.
Put your re-registration months on a calendar so you don’t miss the window.
watchOuts: Vehicles, phone numbers, school/work, emails and online IDs all have short 48-hour clocks.

summary: Most changes are due within 48 hours; international trips need 21 days’ notice.
Moving out? Tell the sheriff 48 hours before you leave to establish residence elsewhere.
watchOuts: If you can’t reach DMV immediately, you still owe the sheriff report—don’t wait.
